content:
Alrighty, so I got this module ported. I got it moved over to the Backdrop contrib team on github. Then I got lost. Dont know what to do next. Am I done setting it up on Github? What do I do to get it into the module list on backdropcms.org Help? https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/views_selective_filters

backdrop-contrib/views_selective_filters
Backdrop port of Views Selective Filters Module. Contribute to backdrop-contrib/views_selective_filters development by creating an account on GitHub.

And here's the issue on contrib about it: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/contrib/issues/366

Port of Views Selective Filters 路 Issue #366 路 backdrop-ops/contrib
I'm attempting my first Drupal 7 module port for Views Selective Filters: https://www.drupal.org/project/views_selective_filters I think I've got the baseline work done at: https://github.c...
@Bob Christenson Once you make a stable release in Github it'll automatically show up on B.org
Thanks, any docs on how to do that?

https://help.github.com/en/github/administering-a-repository/managing-releases-in-a-repository#creating-a-release

Use 1.x-1.0.0 for the tag and the name/title. Description can be something like 'Initial release'. That's it! :smiley:
Thanks! I generally only manage my own private code on github, never really done publicly released stuff before. Thanks for the link.
OK, I think I did it...I'll watch for it to show up on BackdropCMS.org and hopefully it all worked as it should. Thanks again for the assist!
Just saw that..sweet! I think after 15 years in Drupal, I may finally need to learn how to submit/manage contrib modules :) Thanks for making it easy (so far...)

One aside, it may be unofficial but I think the standard versioning is to try to track the Drupal 7 version number for ease of comparison. So a module that is released as 7.x-1.5 would get released as 1.x-1.5.0 in Backdrop.
@Laryn based on the version were it deviated into a backdrop module?
Yes, or the version that future D7 changes implemented which are merged into the Backdrop module.
K, I just did what @BWPanda (Peter) told me to :) So...blame him. hehe. Should I change anything or just leave it?
Your call. :grinning:
How would I know which version I should start with? I'm not even sure where it was when I branched it off from Drupal.
Looking at dates in the commit history, it looks like you have branched the dev version, (which is typical) and is slightly ahead of 7.x-1.5.

I switched some modules to track the Drupal version after some time of using its own. You could wait until there's a new release and then jump to 1.x-1.5.0 Not a big deal. I put a note in the release explaining the jump
